resources.string:
Operating principle:

1. Compile *.java files into *.class class files. 
2. Use Google's R8 | D8 tool to compile the *.class file into a *.dex file that the Android platform can run. This step can be de-sugared, and the high-version JDK syntactic sugar can be run on the Android platform. The internal implementation is basically still the syntactic sugar converted into low-version compatible code. 
3. Load the *.dex file into the application through DexClassLoader, and look for the main method reflection call. 
4. Input System.in and output System.out of the proxy system.
